records.title: With the receiver in scope
quotes: Concision is the chief Kotlin’s motto
The key quality of the code that we are looking to achieve is not concision, but readability

records.title: AndroidDevPodcast:113
gained: android-11: adb now is incremental. Useful for large game apks. Works only on Pixel phone
android-11: adb wifi debug is updated: solved problems, easier to use
android-11: security audit library
reason of google-maps crash: google-services updated when app started > app crashes > google released google-services fix > app starts and tries to update google-services, but crashes
android-studio: dagger graph review
google-play: introduced policy of subscriptions screen
google-play: updated policy of location

records.title: Android 11 Changes
gained: Android 9: you were available to use a camera and microphone only in the foreground
Android 11: you need to write service type
Android 11: asyncmtask is deprecated
Android 11: getting phone number data requires permission

records.title: Working remotely
gained: Call and talk if you worried about something, dont keep it as it is
Be more and explicitly transparent
Writing clarity matters
Aligning goals often
Ask if you want/need something

records.title: Thoughts about Event Handling on Android
gained: some time of events (states) shouldnt be stored as state: temp error message, navigation event as it might be repeated (when screen is rotated for example)
solutions: one stream of events, two streams, multiple observers
If we want to notify the View about something just once, we can’t place that data in the ViewState
